Boris Džonson se izvinio što nije ostvario Bregzit kao što je obećao

03 Nov 2019, 11:25

Britanski premijer Boris Džonson izvinio se danas zato što nije ostvario izlazak zemlje iz EU 31. oktobra kao što je obećao i branio svoj sporazum o tome postignut sa Evropskom unijom.Na pitanje novinara Skaj njuza (Sky News) da li bi se izvinio članovima svoje Konzervativne stranke koji su ga doveli na vlast zato što nije održao reč Džonson je odgovorio "svakako".Džonson je stigao na vlast u julu obećavajući da će biti sproveden Bregzit 31. jula šta god da košta, i rekao da bi radije umro u jarku nego tražio novo odlaganje Bregzta. Ali, morao je da traži odlaganje do 31. januara, pošto njegov dogovor o razlazu postignut sa Briselom nije dobio odobrenje Parlamenta.Džonson je zbog toga danas u intervjuu izrazio "duboko žaljenje".Britanski premijer je takodje kritikovao američkog predsednika Donalda Trampa, svog prijatelja i saveznika, koji je u četvrtak ocenio da dogovor postignut sa EU ne dozvoljava da se sklapaju trgovinski sporazumi sa Velikom Britanijom."Ne želim da ocrnim predsednika ali s tim u vezi on očigledno greši. Ko god pogleda naš sporazum može da vidi da je izvanredan", rekao je Džonson.On je rekao da to odlaganje nije toliko bolno zbog obećanja ili njegovog ega već zbog neizvesnosti šta to donosi za celu zemlju."Firme ne mogu da prave predvidjanja, porodice ne mogu da planiraju, ljudi ne znaju kada će Bregzit da se dogodi", rekao je Džonson.Objasnio je da strahuje da će biti još odlaganja ukoliko glavna opoziciona Laburistička stranka dodje na vlast posle prevremenih izbora 12. decembra. On je ocenio "ludim" predlog te partije da se ponovo pregovara o izlaznom dogovoru sa EU i da se podnese Britancima na glasanje.Džonson je takodje izjavio da ne vidi nikakav razlog da se produži prelazni period posle Bregzita dalje od predvidjenog datuma, odnosno decembra 2020, ocenivši da bi trgovinski pregovori trebalo da budu izuzetno jednostavni.

Boris Johnson apologized for not achieving Bregzit as promised

03 Nov 2019, 11:25

British Prime Minister Boris Johnson apologized today for failing to achieve the country's exit from the EU on October 31, as he promised and defended his agreement reached with the European Union. Asked by Sky News reporter if he would apologize to members of his Conservative parties who brought him to power because he did not keep his word Johnson replied "certainly." Johnson came to power in July promising to implement Bregzit on July 31 at whatever cost, saying he would rather die in the ditch than seek a new deposition of Bregzt. But he had to seek a postponement until January 31st, as his divorce deal reached with Brussels did not get Parliament's approval. Johnson, in an interview today, expressed "deep regret". The British prime minister also criticized US President Donald Trump, his friend and an ally, who said Thursday that an agreement reached with the EU does not allow trade agreements to be concluded with the UK. "I do not want to denigrate the president, but in this regard he is clearly wrong. Whoever looks at our agreement can see it is extraordinary "He said that the delay was not so painful because of the promise or his ego, but because of the uncertainty of what it brings for the whole country." Companies can't make predictions, families can't plan, people don't know when Bregzit will to happen, "Johnson said. He explained he feared there would be more delays if the main opposition Labor Party came to power after early elections. cembra. He assessed the party's "crazy" proposal to renegotiate the exit deal with the EU and submit it to the British for a vote. Johnson also said he saw no reason to extend the post-Bregit transition beyond the scheduled date, ie December 2020. , assessing that trade negotiations should be extremely straightforward.
